intro: Leptorkis commutata, commonly known as the common rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and small, upright flowering stems that bear clusters of bright yellow flowers. Its flowers are actinomorphic, with four petals and numerous stamens, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Leptorkis commutata is often found in open habitats and can tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
